title: Moxie Cinema and the Terrible, No Good, Very Bad Day...aka The Projector Broke
body: UPDATE: The projector is working again. All shows are BACK ON, BABY! I always hate to be the bearer of bad news, but here it is anyways: Last night while we were testing the brand new beautiful print of Pan's Labyrinth, the projector pretty much exploded. It was scary - sparks and fumes, loud popping noises, and pieces flying about. It turns out something happened with either the rectifier (sp?) or the lamphouse, both of which are instrumental pieces for projecting a film onto our screen. Alas, Dan and Justin stayed up until early early morning taking the projector apart and putting it back together, and they would have gotten it to work (they're pretty talented guys) except for the fact that there's one piece that busted and can't be fixed. It needs a new part. So, they are on their way to St. Louis to pick up parts and hopefully get everything back up and running for Thursday shows. Yes, that means tonight's shows are cancelled. Great timing, eh? I mean, it's not like we're opening the most anticipated film of the year tonight or anything. Or maybe there's a jinx attached with the film? We apologize for any inconvenience (I know there were a lot of excited people - me included - who were planning on watching the film tonight). If you already purchased your ticket, you may stop by tonight to pick up a free pass from 6pm to 8pm, otherwise we'll give them to you when you come in next (but don't try to be sneaky - we have a ticket count). And now I'm going to cry in the corner. I'm not very good with stressful situations.
author: Nicole

Posted By: evilvetMan, Cosmik, that must've been one helluva watch.
' Haha. Pun.

comments.author: Cosmik
comments.body:
Boy, I had a lamp blow up once on my watch.  (Of course, since it was my first exploding lamp, and it was encased in the projector house, I didn't know what the sound was, only that I heard it, but I couldn't find anything off in the dark of the projection floor, and I couldn't really hear either of the guests in the theatre yelling.  Finally the manager radioed up and I took a peek in the theatre, saw it was dark and thought "ah, THAT'S what that was.")  It was a big mess of glass shards, and being new to the job, I didn't know how to change the lamp yet.

This looks SO much worse.

comments.body: Dan, your dedication to keeping the Moxie in good working order is something to be admired and respected.

comments.author: justin
comments.body: I just bought a new camera and I'm all itchy to use it, so I took it with us to St. Louis to document the entire Moxie projector saga. Check it out: http://www.flickr.com/photos/justinglow/sets/72157594524050945/ I recommend starting with the first picture and working forward, because it's done in a refreshing narrative style!

comments.author: EdMo
comments.body:
Posted By: danNEWS: After an extremely long two days, and a quick 8 hour trip to STL and back, I'm happy to report that the new projector pieces are sitting safe inside the Moxie. An electrician will be by in the morning to rewire the new rectifier, and I'm hoping I can get a projection tech from Joplin to swing by and help me finish the install. Keep your fingers crossed that Joplin Joe doesn't have any plans tomorrow afternoon!!! More updates to come.
Crossed.
